report_title: Powder Coating Services in the US
executive_summary: Powder coating services have endured severe volatility through the current period because of the pandemic and skyrocketing interest rates. Many key buyers, like automakers, consumer electronics manufacturers and residential construction, rely on consumer demand; low interest rates and more time at home led to increased home improvement spending during the pandemic, bolstering furniture manufacturing markets. However, climbing interest rates have threatened this market despite lower office vacancies leading to greater demand for office furniture. Even so, pent-up demand for travel has led to rebounding automotive markets. The industry's market diversity has prevented one market's downturn from severely limiting the overall industry's growth. Revenue has climbed at an expected CAGR of 1.4% to $2.3 billion through the current period despite stagnating in 2024, where profit will reach an estimated 10.7%.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The pandemic led to unprecedented changes in consumer behavior and supply chain disruptions. Many key markets, especially consumer-facing markets, crashed in 2020 following severe economic uncertainty. However, strong residential construction markets uplifted demand in 2021 as homeowners heavily spent on home improvements, furniture and other items requiring powder coating.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Climbing interest rates pose a new set of challenges
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Skyrocketing interest rates have stifled growth in residential construction markets; similarly, high inflation and low consumer confidence have discouraged consumers from making more expensive purchases, like cars, furniture and consumer electronics. Even so, federal, state and local governments have lifted lockdown restrictions, leading to pent-up demand for travel. This trend bolstered demand for new and used vehicles, leading to higher demand for powder coating services.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Companies benefit from increasingly strict environmental regulations
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Increasingly stringent environmental rules will support powder coating services through the outlook period. Unlike liquid paints, powder coatings contain no solvents and release little to no amount of Volatile Organic Compounds (VOC) into the atmosphere. Finishers won't need to buy costly pollution control equipment if they use powder coating. Companies can comply more easily with the regulations set by the US Environmental Protection Agency.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Innovations will continue to drive growth
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The Powder Coating Services industry will expand largely because of advancements in powder coating technology, including UV-curable powder coatings. UV-curable powder coatings permit employees to powder coat other materials like plastics, composites, carbon fiber, and medium-density fiberboard because of the minimum heat and oven dwell time required to process these components.

industry_definition: Companies in this industry powder coat metals and metal products for an extensive network of manufacturers. Companies offer a wide range of solvents, with epoxy and polyester powder coating being the most popular.

opportunities: High Performance Drivers Industrial production index

key_trends: Companies have endured severe volatility. The pandemic, soaring inflation, and supply chain disruptions have posed major challenges to powder coating services and key clients.
Companies will benefit from innovation. New products will broaden the industry's horizon, especially as buyers look for more sustainable solutions.
Companies must adhere to strict environmental regulations regarding volatile organic compounds (VOCs) and potentially other Companies have strived to create more environmentally friendly products.
Companies don't benefit from any industry-specific government support. Many companies join trade associations to boost visibility, improve networks, and gain other benefits.
Powder coating services are integral for a wide range of manufacturing operations. Companies derive revenue stability from the breadth of diverse buyers.
Epoxy and polyester coatings are staples for powder coating services. Companies offer a diverse array of products to solve various client demands.
Powder coating fills a different niche compared with paints and other finishes. Powder coatings are often more durable and are the preferred option for many manufacturers.
Most companies compete locally. Few companies have the scope to dominate markets past regional markets, given the importance of establishing connections with local buyers and suppliers.
Powder coating service companies face high purchasing costs. The industry has endured volatile purchase costs, especially as crude oil prices skyrocketed following the pandemic.
Companies have expanded profit by passing costs onto buyers. Successful companies have skilled workforces with established.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Companies serve a diverse array of other markets including architecture, general industrial uses like antennas, lighting fixtures, lockers, cafeteria tables, bicycles and sporting equipment.

Automotive markets use powder coating for various auto parts, including oil and fuel filters, shock absorbers, battery trays, brake pads, engine block casings, suspension components, radiators, wheels, grills, bumpers, door handles, roof racks, trailer hitches and exterior and interior trim.

Buyers use powder coatings for a diverse range of consumer and household goods, including refrigerators, washer tops and lids, dryer drums, air conditioner cabinets, water heaters, range housings, vacuum cleaners, dishwashers, microwave oven cavities and freezer cabinets. These coatings also include antimicrobial-protected powder coatings used in healthcare equipment and medical devices.
Furniture manufacturers commonly use powder for metal cabinets, wooden furniture, metal parts of office chairs, shelving systems and outdoor metal furniture.

products_and_services.product_description: Polyester powder coating (PPC) offers quick drying, chemical resistance, temperature resistance, abrasion resistance and surface protection, making this option extremely versatile, especially for general industrial uses.

Epoxy-polyester powder or hybrid coatings are a mixture of polyester and epoxy resins primarily used for interior applications, like furniture coatings. Strong furniture markets during the pandemic supported epoxy-polyester sales.

Epoxy resins are resistant to stains, cracking, extreme temperatures and blistering, making them widely usable in diverse manufacturing and finishing industries. Because of corrosion and temperature-resistant qualities, epoxies are common in larger structural foundations and high-load-bearing structures.

Some companies also use polyvinyl chloride (PVC), polyvinylidene chloride (PDVC), polyolefins, polyamides and polyvinylidene fluoride (PVDF), though these options are significantly less common than polyester and epoxy.

Polyurethane powder coatings exhibit properties similar to epoxy powders but also offer exterior durability and are often more 'overbake stable' than epoxies. Even so, polyurethane coatings have a more restricted cure range, carry a potential odor or smoke and have a significantly higher cost.

Acrylic resins offer similar qualities to epoxy and polyester; however, acrylic's clear coating makes it valuable across a wide range of manufacturing and finishing industries. Acrylic is typically less resistant and durable compared with epoxy.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Climbing consumer confidence will enable the consumer goods market to expand through the outlook period.
Pent-up demand for travel has combatted rising prices, creating stability in automotive markets.

Furniture manufacturers commonly use powder for metal cabinets, wooden furniture, metal parts of office chairs, shelving systems and outdoor metal furniture. This market soared during the pandemic as private spending on home improvement, housing starts and other key housing metrics skyrocketed.
The country's return to in-person work will stimulate demand for office furniture.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast region has the highest percentage of establishments at 24.1% and accounts for 21.5% of the industry's population.
The Southwest region has 21.9% of establishments but the highest population percentage at 29.7%.
The Great Lakes region accounts for 18.8% of establishments and 15.1% of the industry's population.
The Mid-Atlantic region has 14.3% of establishments and 15.2% of the population.
The Plains region accounts for 9.2% of establishments but only 6.8% of the population.
The Rocky Mountains region has 6.5% of establishments and 7.2% of the population.
The New England region has the lowest percentage at 5.2% of establishments and 4.5% of the population.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Skilled Labor is Essential for Success
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Powder coating services are highly labor intensive; workers require extensive experience to safely and efficiently coat metals and alloys, leading to higher-than-average yearly salaries and wage expenses.

Purchases make up more than one-third of expenses for the average powder coating service provider. Companies rely on raw material purchases, including steel, zinc, chemicals, polymers and powdered wire.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The industry is experiencing a low level of both the rate of new patents and the concentration of patents in the industry. This creates an environment where the threat of new technologies driving disruption is low.

The major markets for this industry are highly concentrated, which implies that the market has a focus on key customer segments. This presents an opportunity for strategic entrance into lower-end markets or unserved markets for innovations to take on a disruptive trajectory.

volatility_points.volatility_description: The pandemic created unprecedented market volatility across the industry's key buyers and suppliers. On one side, residential construction skyrocketed, leading to stellar growth in 2021, even as nonresidential construction markets plummeted.

Similarly, the pandemic and the Russian invasion of Ukraine have led to extremely volatile supply chains, particularly steel-related ones. Most buyers rely on steel and other crude oil byproducts; higher prices have encouraged buyers to cut costs, leading to subdued demand.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: POLYESTER POWDER COATINGS ARE POPULAR IN EVERYDAY ITEMS
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Polyester powder coating (PPC) offers quick drying, chemical resistance, temperature resistance, abrasion resistance, and surface protection, making this option extremely versatile, especially for general industrial uses.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: EPOXY POWDER COATINGS SERVE A WIDE RANGE OF USES
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Epoxy resins are resistant to stains, cracking, extreme temperatures, and blistering, making them widely usable in diverse manufacturing and finishing industries. Because of corrosion and temperature-resistant qualities, epoxies are common in larger structural foundations and high-load-bearing structures.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Polyurethane and Acrylic are Common Alternatives
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Acrylic resins offer similar qualities to epoxy and polyester; however, acrylic's clear coating makes it valuable across a wide range of manufacturing and finishing industries. Acrylic is typically less resistant and durable compared with epoxy.
